article.title: About Galaxy Project
article.content:
About Galaxy Project

Galaxy is an open, web-based platform for accessible, reproducible, and transparent computational biomedical research.

  • Accessible: Users without programming experience can easily specify parameters and run tools and workflows.
  • Reproducible: Galaxy captures information so that any user can repeat and understand a complete computational analysis.
  • Transparent: Users share and publish analyses via the web and create Pages, interactive, web-based documents that describe a complete analysis.

See the Learn page for help on using Galaxy, and the Admin page for help on setting up your own instance.

You can take a look at the current members of the core project team. We are funded by NIH, NSF, Penn State, Johns Hopkins, and the Pennsylvania Department of Public Health.

  • Galaxy Platform Directory
  • Citing Galaxy
  • News
  • Events
  • Project Statistics

Major funding for the Galaxy Project is provided by NIH Grant 2U41HG006620.
